meanings.definition: To get rid of or give away
meanings.sent1: She was disposing of old clothes to make room for new ones.
meanings.sent2: He disposed of the broken toys by throwing them away.
meanings.sent3: The cat was disposing of the unwanted mouse toys in a playful manner.
meanings.sent4: The gardener disposed of the weeds as if they were no longer welcome guests.
meanings.sent5: After the party, they disposed of the leftover food to prevent it from spoiling.

meanings.sent1: He was disposing the books on the shelf in alphabetical order.
meanings.sent2: She disposed the furniture in a way that made the room look spacious.
meanings.sent3: The children were disposing the building blocks to create a colorful pattern.
meanings.sent4: The artist disposed the colors on the palette like a master painter.
meanings.sent5: The teacher disposed the desks in a circle for group activities.

meanings.sent1: The warm weather disposed them to go for a walk in the park.
meanings.sent2: His friendly smile disposed people to trust him easily.
meanings.sent3: The delicious smell of cookies disposed the children to gather around the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: Her kind words disposed him to forgive her mistake.
meanings.sent5: The peaceful music disposed the audience to relax and enjoy the concert.
